| HistoryText             = Dubbed by [[Clinton Barton (Earth-616)|Hawkeye]] as the "Tracksuit Draculas", this mafia worked in New York City. They had many encounters with the archer, including facing him when he tried to force [[Ivan Banionis (Earth-616)|Ivan Banionis]], one of their members, to sell his apartment building to him;{{r|Hawkeye Vol 4 1}} fighting against Barton when they attempted to kidnap Ivan's runaway wife, [[Cherry (Earth-616)|Cherry]], whose connection to them was unknown to him;{{r|Hawkeye Vol 4 3}} and, finally, trying to force Barton to return the building to them. Despite their threats to kill all of its residents, Hawkeye managed to confront and defeat them.{{r|Hawkeye Vol 4 6}}

They hired the assassin known as [[Kazimierz Kazimierczak (Earth-616)|The Clown]] to finish off Barton once and for all,{{r|Hawkeye Vol 4 8}} as the company they were connected to wanted to raze the buildings in the neighborhood to build a shopping mall, but couldn't because of Hawkeye's control over that one.{{r|Hawkeye Vol 4 15}}

After Ivan's return,{{r|Hawkeye Vol 4 19}} the tracksuit mafia raided Barton's building but were opposed by heavy resistance from its inhabitants.{{r|Hawkeye Vol 4 21}} In the end, [[Katherine Bishop (Earth-616)|Kate Bishop]] subdued Ivan, and Barton dealt with the Clown while the rest of the neighbors contained the remaining tracksuits until the arrival of the police.{{r|Hawkeye Vol 4 22}}

| Equipment               = 
| Transportation          = Numerous cars
| Weapons                 = Bats, guns

| Notes                   = * After doing some research, Kate Bishop referred to the gang as [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Titushky "titushskis"].
